title: Abbie Chatfield claims double standards when Ciarran Stott poses nude on The Bachelorette
text:
Ciarran Stott was praised as 'confident' for posing nude on Thursday night's episode of The Bachelorette.

But Bachelor runner-up Abbie Chatfield believes a double standard was at play, as she was recently 'sl*t shamed' for posing in a bikini.

Taking to Instagram, the 25-year-old property analyst highlighted the difference in public reactions to her and Ciarran in a fiery rant.

'Can you imagine if I had done this?' Abbie Chatfield (pictured) claimed Australians have double standards when Ciarran Stott posed nude with grapes covering his privates on Thursday night's episode of The Bachelorette

'Love this from The Bachelorette Australia but can you imagine if I had done this? Posed naked with fruit covering two per cent of my body?' Abbie wrote.

'There were photos of me in bikinis that I got sl*t shamed for and made to feel like I wasn't worth loving, but all the comments seem to be (laughing emoji) or (fire emoji).'

She sarcastically ended the rant: 'But nah, Australia is super progressive.'

Making a point: Abbie highlighted that Ciarran was praised for his raunchy snap while she was recently 'sl*t shamed' for wearing a bikini

The Bachelorette Australia's official Instagram account also posted a photo of Ciarran posing nude with nothing but grapes covering his private parts.

'All of Australia right now: it's a lot,' Abbie commented on the post.

This isn't the first time The Bachelor runner-up has taken a stand against 'sl*t shaming' as she received a lot of public backlash during her stint on the show.

Raunchy! The Bachelorette Australia's official Instagram account also posted a photo of Ciarran posing nude with nothing but grapes covering his private parts

Joker! 'All of Australia right now: it's a lot,' Abbie commented on the post

Last month Abbie directed a post at her critics, both male and female, who had shamed her for expressing her sexuality on The Bachelor.

She wrote: 'Things I got sl*t shamed for on The Bachelor: This bikini, my skirt at hometowns, multiple cocktail party gowns, kissing Matt "without a date" and at a cocktail party (out of sight of anyone).'

Abbie explained that she 'did not expect to be sl*t shamed in 2019' and emphasised that 'sex is essential to a successful relationship'.
